strapiPost.title: 63rd Annual Poultry Festival Flocks To Rogers
strapiPost.content:
The top poultry and egg industry leaders from around the country will gather for the 63rd Annual Poultry Festival, enjoying a weekend of networking and team building at the Rogers Convention Center from Jun 9-10.

  • Eggsellent time: The two-day festival offers a variety of activities — golf and fishing tournaments, trap shooting, women in poultry brunch, scholarship auction, awards ceremony, cooking competitions, and more along a Vegas-themed stretch called the Chicken Strip. – and will conclude with a concert by Chris Janson with special guests Ray Fulcher and Southerland on Jun 10 at the Walmart AMP.
  • Golden yolk: Arkansas's robust poultry industry supports over 158,000 jobs and generates over $39b annually. Last year, the Poultry Festival sold over 4,500 tickets, bringing $4.19m to the Rogers economy.

Register as a group or purchase individual passes HERE.
